conversation.text: How long should I bake the salmon?
evidence: Bake the fillets for 15 minutes

conversation.text: You should bake the salmon fillets for 15 minutes.
evidence: Bake the fillets for 15 minutes

conversation.text: What is the first step?
Preheat your oven to 400 F or 200 C. Wait until the oven is thoroughly heated up before cooking salmon.
evidence: Preheat the oven to 400℉ (200℃)

conversation.text: Okay done. What do I do next?
Prepare a baking sheet to cook the salmon in. Line it with aluminum foil.

Season the salmon with salt, pepper, and mustard

conversation.text: How much salt, pepper, and mustard?
Add 3 tablespoons of the mustard, and salt and pepper to taste.

Add 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs. Add 1/4 cup of melted butter to help breadcrumbs to stick. Do your fillets have skin on them?

0.25 cups (59 mL) of melted butter over the 4 fillets.

conversation.text: Yes, my fillets have skin.
Make sure the skin is the side touching the pan.

conversation.text: Okay looks good. What's next?
Do your fillets have at least 1 inch of space between them?
evidence: Transfer the fillets to the baking sheet.
eaving at least 1 inch (2.5 cm) of space between them

conversation.text: No, they are closer together.
Please arrange the salmon so that there is 1 inch between them.
Okay, done. What's next?
Bake the salmon for 15 minutes. Use the middle rack of the oven. When finished, you should be able to split salmon with a fork.
evidence: Bake the fillets for 15 minutes.
When it’s finished cooking, you should be able to easily split the salmon with a fork.

conversation.text: Okay, it's been 15 minutes but it looks a little mushy.
Can you flake the salmon with a fork? If not, place the fillets back in for 2 minute increments. You can also use a meat thermometer to check that the meat is at least 145 F (63 C)
evidence: If the fillets don’t seem cooked, place them back in the oven for 2-minute increments.
Check the pieces periodically with a meat thermometer, and make sure that the meat is at least 145 °F (63 °C).

conversation.text: Okay I cooked the salmon for an extra 2 minutes.
How does the salmon look? Can you split the meat with a fork?
evidence: When it’s finished cooking, you should be able to easily split the salmon with a fork

conversation.text: Yes, it looks cooked. So can I serve it now?
Yes, it is best to serve immediately with a soft side dish, like roasted potatoes. For a more savory meal, serve it with asparagus instead. Fresh lemon juice is nice too.
evidence: Remove the fillets from the oven and serve them immediately
Pair the fillets with a softer side dish, like roasted potatoes
If you’re aiming to create a more savory meal, include a vegetable like asparagus instead

conversation.text: Okay that sounds great!
Do you have any left over salmon?
evidence: Refrigerate the fillets by putting them on a plate and wrapping them in plastic.
Make sure that each piece has cooled before doing this. Your salmon will stay fresh for about 3 days!

conversation.text: Yes I do. What do I do with it?
Make sure the salmon has cooled down, then wrap in plastic wrap. You can then refrigerate them, and they should stay fresh for up to 3 days.
evidence: Refrigerate the fillets by putting them on a plate and wrapping them in plastic.
Make sure that each piece has cooled before doing this. Your salmon will stay fresh for about 3 days!

conversation.text: Okay, thank you for the delicious meal.
No problem! I am glad you enjoyed it. Do you have any other questions?
Nope, that's all. Thanks again!
Okay then, bye!
Bye! It was a great meal.

procedure.description: Set your oven’s temperature and wait for the appliance to reach the proper heat. Although it may be tempting to start cooking the fish as soon as possible, it’s important to let the oven hit the desired temperature first. If you set it to something lower, there’s a chance that the salmon won’t cook properly.

procedure.summary: Prepare a baking sheet with shallow sides by covering it with nonstick aluminum foil.
procedure.description: Make sure that the foil is covering the entire surface of the pan, or at least the parts that the salmon will be sitting on. If necessary, use scissors to trim the foil so that it fits the pan exactly. Coat the pan with nonstick cooking spray if you don't have aluminum foil on hand.

procedure.summary: Season the fillets with mustard, salt and pepper.
procedure.description: Spread 3 tablespoons (44 mL) of Dijon mustard evenly over the surface of each fillet before topping the pieces with ¼ cup (25 g) of breadcrumbs and equal amounts of salt and pepper. Help the different seasonings stick together by drizzling 0.25 cups (59 mL) of melted butter over the 4 fillets. If the salmon fillets have skin on them, make sure the skin is touching the line of foil on the pan. Make sure that the fillets are all spaced evenly. If you’d like to try preparing your salmon with some different flavor combinations, try dill butter or lemon relish instead.

procedure.summary: Transfer the fillets to the baking sheet.
procedure.description: Move each piece of salmon onto the prepared baking tray, leaving at least 1 inch (2.5 cm) of space between them. If the salmon fillets have skin on them, have the skin be touching the line of foil on the pan.

Place the baking sheet on the middle rack in the oven and wait for the salmon to cook completely. When it’s finished cooking, you should be able to easily split the salmon with a fork. If the fillets don’t seem cooked, place them back in the oven for 2-minute increments. Check the pieces periodically with a meat thermometer, and make sure that the meat is at least 145 °F (63 °C).

procedure.summary: Remove the fillets from the oven and serve them immediately.
procedure.description: Pair the fillets with a softer side dish, like roasted potatoes. If you’re aiming to create a more savory meal, include a vegetable like asparagus instead. Feel free to squeeze some fresh lemon juice over the meal for an extra zing. While the fillets don’t have to be eaten right away, they’ll taste delicious coming fresh from the oven. Refrigerate the fillets by putting them on a plate and wrapping them in plastic. Make sure that each piece has cooled before doing this. Your salmon will stay fresh for about 3 days!
